Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to understand the normative process and the desiderata properly The user provided a detailed scenario with specific rules and some best practices My task is to analyze the event log for three cases 1 2 3 and determine which ones violate the strict rules and which ones just miss the recommended best practices

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The key here is to check each case against the sequence and ordering rules provided Let me list out the required steps in order again to make sure I dont miss anything The sequence is Application Received  Credit Check  Risk Assessment  Loan Decision  Inform Applicant  If Approved Finalize Documentation  Close Case Also important constraints like Credit Check before Risk Assessment and Finalize Documentation only if approved before closing

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1 first The activities in order are Application Received then Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case That seems to follow the sequence exactly All steps are in order and since it was approved they finalized docs before closing So no violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Lets check each step The first activity is Application Received at 0800 The next activity at 0820 is Risk Assessment Wait the normative rule says Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Here they did Risk Assessment before Credit Check Thats a violation of the ordering rule Then they did Credit Check at 0900 but thats after Risk Assessment which is not allowed Thats a problem

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Moving on after that they made a Loan Decision Rejected at 0930 Then they Inform Applicant presumably but in the log the next step after Loan Decision is Finalize Documentation at 1000 But since the decision was rejected the process says you shouldnt finalize docs after rejection Finalizing docs after rejection is explicitly prohibited So thats another violation Then they closed the case So Case 2 has two violations Risk Assessment before Credit Check and Finalize Docs after rejection

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Lets see The first step is Application Received at 0900 The next Credit Check is on the same day Wait looking at the timestamps the next step is Credit Check at 2024 01 14 1000 Wait the application was received on 01 12 and Credit Check is on 01 14 Thats two days later The desiderata says Credit Check should be within 24 hours but since thats a desideratum not a normative rule its not a violation of the strict rules just a best practice issue

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Continuing with Case 3s normative checks The order is Credit Check after the delay  Risk Assessment  Loan Decision Approved  Inform Applicant  Finalize Docs  Close Case The sequence here follows the required order The Credit Check was after the 24 hour window but thats a desideratum The other steps are in order The Loan Decision was Approved so they did finalize docs before closing which is correct The only possible issue here is the timing for Credit Check and Inform Applicant but those are desiderata not normative So Case 3 doesnt have any normative violations

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait looking back at the normative sequence after Loan Decision comes Inform Applicant then based on approval finalize In Case 2s log the Loan Decision Rejected is at 0930 then the next activity is Finalize Documentation at 1000 which is a normative violation But between Loan Decision and Finalize they should have informed the applicant first The Inform Applicant steps timestamp isnt listed here Wait looking at the log for Case 2 after Loan Decision at 0930 the next step is Finalize Documentation at 1000 Wait that skips the Inform Applicant step Wait the log for Case 2 has the Loan Decision at 0930 followed by Finalize Documentation at 1000 then Close Case at 1030 Wait but the Inform Applicant must come after Loan Decision So in the log the Inform step is missing Wait the normative process requires that after Loan Decision you must first Inform Applicant then proceed So in Case 2 after Loan Decision Rejected you have to inform the applicant before you can finalize docs if approved or close But in the log after decision they did Finalize Docs then Close But since the decision was rejection they shouldnt have finalized docs at all which is a normative violation but also they skipped informing the applicant Wait the problems textual description says Following the loan decision the applicant must be informed of the outcome So the Inform step is mandatory If its missing thats a normative violation So in Case 2 they didnt inform the applicant Thats a major issue Therefore the absence of Inform Applicant in the log for Case 2 is a normative violation So thats three normative violations for Case 2 1 Risk Assessment before Credit Check order violation 2 Finalizing Docs after Rejection violation 3 Skipping the Inform Applicant step entirely violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now moving to desiderata for each case Case 1 Check the timing for Credit Check The application was at 0900 Credit Check at 0930 which is within 24 hours so thats good Informing the applicant Loan Decision at 1100 Inform at 1300 11 to 13 is 2 hours which is within the 48 hour recommendation So no desiderata violations here except maybe the Follow up Call Since the Follow up isnt in the log thats a desideratum issue

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 The Credit Check after Risk Assessment is a normative violation so thats already covered For desiderata the Credit Check was done after Risk Assessment but since thats a normative issue its not part of the desiderata The other desiderata for Case 2 The time for Credit Check after application The application was at 0800 Credit Check at 0900 within 24 hours so maybe thats okay The Inform Applicant time since they skipped the Inform step entirely thats a normative issue but even if they had done it the timing would be but since the step is missing its a normative violation But for desiderata the timing recommendations only apply if they did the step Since they didnt do the Inform step the timing isnt applicable here Additionally for Case 2 they also failed the Follow up Call

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Credit Check was 2 days later 2024 01 12 to 01 14  2 days so 48 hours exceeding the 24 hour desideratum The Inform Applicant step Loan Decision at 1200 on 14th then Inform at 1500 on the same day Wait the timestamps for Case 3s Inform is at 2024 01 14 1200 Wait the Case 3s log shows Ah the Inform Applicant for Case 3 was done on 1 16 at 1500 The Loan Decision was on 1 14 1200 The time between Decision 14th 12 and Inform 16th 15 is two days and 3 hours which exceeds the 48 hour desideratum 48 hours is two days so 48 hours would be up to 0000 of the next day Wait 14th Decision at 1200 then 48 hours would be until 16th 1200 So 16th 1500 is 2 days and 3 hours exceeding the 48 hour recommendation So thats a desideratum Additionally the Credit Check for Case3 was two days later 24 hours is a desideratum so 2 days is a violation No Follow up  desid

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Also the task says identify which cases are violating the normative rules and explain the reasons So in explaining the reasons for Case2s violations  Risk Assessment before Credit Check credit check must come first for proper assessment  Finalizing Docs after rejection against the rules leading to possible unauthorized actions  Missing Inform step essential for transparency and informing the applicant so missing it violates their right to be informed Case2s violations are severe

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now compiling this Normative violations Case2 has violations Case1 none Case3 none Desiderata violations Case1 Failed to do Follow up Call Case2 Failed Follow up Case3 Credit Check took too long 2 days desid Inform took too long over 48 hours desid No Follow up desid
